reviewText:
Not BadThe game is actually pretty balanced in my opinion. Riot Shield Soldiers,Montague and Blitz, are not as over powered as i thought as you need to aim your pistol if you wanna kill but you wont have as much protection as before, giving the enemies a chance. A lot of people do point out how there is absolutely no customization and that is half true and have false. Most guns can have different Camos and attachments but shields don't. And your character has no customization. So its pretty bland. Gameplay is good but I wished there was no video memory limit.

Either than that there is many errors but most and be fixed or at least worked around on. Most errors consists of joing friends with squads and one error doesnt allow you to go past the squad creation part on startup. Im forced to use a VPN for the squad part and sometimes I cant even play with a friend of mine since my NAT Type is strict and I havent found a way to change that as I attemped. Also the fact that my mic would go on out of nowhere was annoying and sometimes they dont even hear you. One thing I've notice is that everyone hate Uplay and I dont know why. In all honesty, I think its pretty good and it takes a minute to make an account and easy to friend your friends. Hit detection is also a problem as in I shot a body through a concrete pillar and killed a guy. Which made no sense.

There isnt many mic spammers or hackers as I played. Most people actaully listen to you when you say put a reinforced wall or put a shield there. In my opion the community isnt bad at all and I think most people who play this game are actaully kind.

If I had to rate this game, the highest I will go is a  7.5/10 With all the glitches and errors thats the only reason why I would rate is this high and I hope the devolepers fix these glitches and problems but anyways  Good job Ubisoft!

reviewText:
I want to like it as much as Rainbow 6 Vegas and Vegas 2, but I don't know what it is, I just can't get as attached as I was to those games. I'm even playing it with the same best friend.
Maybe it's the lack of a co-op story mode (There's a single story mission unlockable actually) and customization that I really wanted. I want to see revised versions of Calypso Casino (Every game mode is now Attack and Defend btw) and some of my favourite T-hunt maps. I also miss my M8, but I'm holding out hope that a DLC character will have it later.

As far as the game itself...It has amazing controller support that switches back to keyboard and mouse on the fly. Runs not that well for how it looks graphically (Typically Ubisoft I guess) and the environment destruction is really well done. I miss night vision and thermals, they weren't great in the old games but this was certainly a chance to make them better. The addition of leaning is appreciated. I don't like that you can't play a bunch of the same character, beyond it possibly breaking immersion I don't think it would really affect the gameplay much. (Even then just force it to be unique characters for ranked only? You have to hit level 25 to get there anyway.) I don't understand the leveling system. I'm level 33 and what does that even mean? You get challenges at certain levels, unlock ranked mode, but why is it going any higher? Seems pointless, unfinished, or a leftover from early design stages. The reknown system in this is well paced, and is BLAZINGLY FAST with boosters. I have 24 hours into this and have more than half the roster of characters with all their unlocks before getting someone new. The microtransaction system is reserved for weapons skins and boosters. It's not really intrusive and feels like it's tacked on just to please someone in corperate or fund the map packs (but the season pass should do that already). You won't notice it compared to other games systems. They give you one booster for free to tease your pallate, but you probably won't even need a second one.
Microtransactions are BAD for $60 titles don't get me wrong, but if you have to do them at all I guess this works.

However, overall I feel like too much of the design changes are following MOBA mentalities, like Siege couldn't hold it's own without copying someones ideas for a major league gaming scene elsewhere. Too many sacrifices are made for this mindset, but it still remains enjoyable and very much a tactical game that requires thought and planning. Most of my issues are missing features...The game feels unfinished and lacking.

Compare it to Rainbow 6 Vegas 1 and (Even with all the bugs in that game) this just isn't very full. I want more of this game, but it isn't here. If there's some sort of Siege add-on story mode that comes out for $30 I will buy it without a second thought. And instead of the Recruit" option when you don't select a character you should get the option to make a character with whatever loadout you want...At the sacrifice that they have no special ability. That would be a nice addition. (Again disable this in ranked only?)

I really want the nostalgia to kick in full force and for me to fall in love with this all over again
date: but really really wanting those custom characters and some really large maps with respawns. This feels too compact.\n\nBut honestly it's still a good game and worth a buy. I'm enjoying it now and I'm sure I'll be enjoying it later."

reviewText:
I have a soft spot in my heart for Tom Clancy's tactical shooters, such as the Rainbow Six series, which was a part of my childhood and teen years. These games have always kept me coming back after months and months of playing, the tactics are great, the gameplay is smooth and challenging, and the community is often solid.

This all goes the same for this wonderful game. Truly very addicting in its gameplay with some new takes on the old, classic Rainbow games. Tight, close quarters combat, tense, very tactical, high octane in its own special way. Rewarding when you win and kick ♥♥♥, crushing when you lose and get the crap kicked out of you, but you have determination to do it again and again, bettering yourself, its so captivating. This game does a great job with being easy on new players, and still challenging and fun for the more experienced ones.

Technically class based combat, its an offense and defense objective based game, though PvP tends to just be class based TDM around 1-2 rooms, and is a test to see who the better attackers and defenders are, but damn if it still isnt a blast to play all the time. This is the first game with PvP that I have been able to enjoy in YEARS. Bad Company 2 and Battlefield 3, a bit of 4, Halo 3 and Reach for a time were the last to have me staying long term and just always enjoying myself, through good and bad. As strictly PvE as I am, the PvP in this game is just amazing. Games are usually always really close ones and players on both sides tend to be respectful all around (though that doesn't mean you won't see the bad apples every once in awhile, but it is rare in my experience).
the PvE itself is also a damn nice, fresh take on the old Terrorist Hunt gamemode. This time around, T-Hunt has several different game modes thrown in on top of the classic mode itself, including one defense mode where you protect your hostage in one room for 3-5 waves, giving you use for Defense Operators outside of the PvP, a wonderful idea. Some, myself included, find T-Hunt to be the far more tactical gamemode in the game.
Another plus is the graphics, which are incredible in this game, and the destruction seems and feels to be on par with Red Faction: Guerrilla. Yes, it is that good and that fun to blow ♥♥♥♥ up in this game, the trailers and all did it justice.

The downsides are very few at the time of writing. All I got are the servers can be very shoddy at times, typically resulting in very slow matchmaking where the game is searching for teams (this is especially bad on Ranked Multiplayer) and you or your teammates can suddenly be dropped from the game between loading a new session or new round in the current session. Extremely aggravating. and the ever-present microtransactions that plague gaming as we know it. Fortunately, all they are for now are very few weapon skins and XP/Renown boosts, which the game already gives a pretty decent enough of anyway, especially since everything currently unlockable with Renown is pretty damn cheap (save for a select weapon skins, not so bad at all). The last downside, there is no offline gamemode, even if you want to solo in Terrorist Hunt, which is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing stupid.

All in all, I have great hopes for the future updates to this game, including FREE MAPS FOR EVERYONE, and 8 new Operators which will have to be bought, sadly. Hopefully the prices on them wont be outrageous.
I HIGHLY recommend this title to anyone curious about it, especially if you love team-based, tactical shooters with great players and very addicting gameplay, it is worth every penny of the $60. I give this one a 9/10. BUY IT! :D

reviewText:
Best game to come out in a while, the company behind this is making all future content free - including maps, operators, and new weapons. The season pass is just to unlock things quicker. So nice compared to other companies like EA that make you pay for maps and new characters(looking at you battlefront).

The audio still has some bugs and sometimes drones fall through the map, but overall very fun/competitve game. I'll probs stop playing CSGO all togehter for this game. And for those that complain there's not enough content - personally I view it the same as counter-strike, meant to be played competitively with other people.

Overall 9/10

reviewText:
This game has all the potential for a tactical coop approach, if...

- you play with like minded people
- use comms.
- assign one squad leader
- stick together (guy with the shield on point...) and cover 360
- go slow
- plan ahead before moving out (use drone)

Reality so far is that it turns out to be a run and gun game, with no comms used, players going for the most kills, blowing holes everywhere and therefore make fellow players vulnerable for attacks and set the group up for failure. Also fun, but not for me and definitely not in the spirit of the old RB6 approach.

The game looks great and has fantastic sounds and I do recommend it , it's just waiting to sort out the tactical coopers and the rambo's.

Best,
Koelshooter

(Koelshooter1 on Uplay)

reviewText:
English:

I regret to say that after having played for more than 200 hours have big cons that make the gameplay is compromised.
- Match Making constant mistake.
- Ping marking on screen is not real-time then you can not watch when players have fluctuations in their connections ..
- Uplay is a disastrous platform and does everything possible to not be able to play with your friends.
- Bugs everywhere.
- Hit Box unrepaired.
- And as a finishing touch has no dedicated server for the community which forces you to play Ubisoft's servers which always have high latency.

This game will own dedicated servers for the community of R6 dies in a couple of months.

I do not recommend it.

Lamento decir que luego de haberlo jugado durante más de 200 horas tiene grandes contras que hacen que la jugabilidad se vea comprometida.
- Match Making error constantes.
- El ping que marca en pantalla no es en tiempo real entonces no podés ver cuando los jugadores tienen fluctuaciones en sus conexiones.
- Uplay es una plataforma desastrosa y que hace todo lo posible para que no puedas jugar con tus amigos.

- Hit Box sin arreglar.
- Y como broche de oro no posee servidor dedicado para la comunidad lo cual te obliga a jugar en los servers de Ubisoft los cuales siempre tienen mucha latencia.

Este juego sin servers dedicados propios para la comunidad de R6 se muere en un par de meses.

reviewText: there are some down sides to this games yes everyone. The optimization is okay and the matchmaking takes about a minute or less for (which isn't that big of a deal). People say getting put against high ranks is a problem In casual. I can agree with that. But for me it wasnt much of a problem. After getting to rank 10 i got the hang of it. I focused alot on flanking and waiting in a hidden spot listeing for people coming by. When theres gun fire I hurry over to it flanking them. But slowly. Taking the enemy out. No one see's it coming when you get them distracted. Do that you can help your team and rack up many kills. This game is perfect for those hardcore tactical and realistic shooter fans. And yes its not ARMA but it still has those elements. This game is a great make. But there is still something missing a campaign. I wish there was one. BUT oh well. This game is a jewl. There isnt anything exacly like it. There some games that come close to its greatness. But they don't. But well thats just opinion. reviewText:
Have played this game for quite a while now and i must say i enjoy this game very much
Although there is an occasional glitch here and there i must say this game is damn addictive

My biggest complaint by far is the fact that the retail version is so so sooooo much more different from the one shown at e3. I'm not sure why many of the features were removed and I'm not sure why the graphics was downgraded. I honestly expected a very realistic game where you had to be careful of you're surroundings or you're pretty much f**ked. But it is realistic compared to a lot of shooters out there today and it is a very good attempt by ubisoft and it was very well done.

I love it, and hate it. Love/Hate relationship. This is probably due to the fact that so many glitches happen that are often game breaking or just utterly irritable. Take my word for it, this game has some game breaking glitches that are super annoying although many of them has been patched now there are still some.

Pros:
-Fun
- Pretty realistic compared to other shooters out there
- Love the in-game currency (renown) which you earn at the end of matches that can assist you in buying new accessories for weapons or unlocking new operators
-Addictive
-Operators are refined and well done. Many of them are fun to play with and have great tools and special characteristics that make them an important asset
-One of the most intense games i have played in a while.

Cons:
-Uplay still has some issues with steam (this might only be me, but i don't know)
- Graphics got downgraded from E3 trailer
- Some bugs in game are still annoying
- e3 gameplay and retail version has large differences. very vast.
-Lack of a single player campaign even though the game is around 60 USD

Overall Rating: 7.9/10

reviewText:
A worthy competitor to Counter-Strike!

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is a first-person tactical shooter, in which players take control of an operator from the Rainbow team, a counter-terrorist unit. Different operators have different races, perks, bombs and gadgets.The game features an asymmetrical structure whereby the teams are not always balanced in their ability choices.Units SWAT, SAS, GSG-9, Spetsnaz and GIGN, each of which has four operators.The game also features a co-op mode to play with friends.


10 Monika IQ "Weiss of 10"

Most people seemingly can't even find a match and even idfthey do, the game will freeze after 1 round or so. If you'd like detailed information on the issues, refer to the Rainbow Six subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/Rainbow6/ (MASSIVE Circlejerk).

They have at least 70 developers permanently working on this game and it is an absolute mystery to me how you can ♥♥♥♥ this up so badly that you cannot even manage to communicate and apologize to your customers anymore. This is the last time I ever bought a Ubisoft game.

reviewText:
The game is for those who enjoy the multiplayer aspect of games.  It is, better then Counter Strike Global Offensive at the moment of writing this.  The game has a great community.  Although some critics say the game lacks content with only 10-ish maps and 3 gamemodes.  It is important to note that the game has 3 great gamemodes, as other 60 USD games that are multiplayer only have 8 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gamemodes and 2 ok gamemodes.  For the maps, 8 out of the 10 are great and the other 2 are good but difficult to play(big).  Also, the maps typically are divided into 3 small sections, these sections contain a hostage at random, or of your choosing depending whether are not you are playing ranked or casual.  So it is more like 30 small maps since you only play on one section of the map at a time.  If you mainly play singleplayer games this is not for you, but it is not being advertised as single player game.  Ever since CS GO died, I have not felt a sence of joy from a competative shooter in a long time, this game gave me that joy.  Also, the game has microtransactions for skins, though I think Ubisoft nailed the microtransactions since they are only for skins and the microtransactions pay for the FREE map packs and operators.  Although it does have its bugs and poor every now and then, Ubisoft did it, and I never thought I would be saying that.

9/10 Great game

Pros: Funs shooter
Great community
Great maps
Filled with multiplayer content

Cons: Bugs
Poor Servers

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
English:

I regret to say that after having played for more than 200 hours have big cons that make the gameplay is compromised.
- Match Making constant mistake.
- Ping marking on screen is not real-time then you can not watch when players have fluctuations in their connections ..
- Uplay is a disastrous platform and does everything possible to not be able to play with your friends.

- And as a finishing touch has no dedicated server for the community which forces you to play Ubisoft's servers which always have high latency.

This game will own dedicated servers for the community of R6 dies in a couple of months.

I do not recommend it.

reviewText:
Rainbow six siege in a nutshell...the game starts after waiting 10 minutes to find a match. I'm on defense. My teammates don't talk to each other and OH GREAT...one of them just backed out of the game. Now it's an unbalanced match. I begin barricading the walls and laying down traps. One of my teammates feels like a dbag and shoots me in the back. I call for help. No one comes. We lose and another teammate leaves the match.

Next round and still no one talks to each other. We scout the area with our drones and fail to find the enemy site. The match begins. I breach a window. The moment the window is breached I spot an enemy that is prone in the corner. I unload my clip into his chest and much to my surprise he is still alive and not moving. At that moment, I know it's over. Two seconds later I get shot by a dude two rooms over that spams his gun through the walls and somehow gets a headshot. We lose again. In chat the enemy team calls us trash. I begin to cry.

Next round on defense again. I Lay traps and wait for the enemies to come. No action for a long time. I begin to move around a little hoping to see something. A few moments later I get one tapped from an enemy shooting through a coin size hole in the wall. I pound my fist in the desk. Suicide seems like a reasonable option. I continue to play for another two hours until my head begins to throb from pound it against the keyboard on my desk.

10 out of 10 would recommend. This game somehow is still fun to me. Don't believe me? Just try it out for yourself and let the suicide vibes roll in.

reviewText:
I will try to tackle some of the major talk points from my own opinion and perspective.

Worried about UPlay being a requirement? Don't be! Launching from Steam still works perfectly well, you will not need to log in to a separate launcher.

Ubisoft's servers are actually fairly stable (the majority of the time). Matchmaking can be almost instantaneous or it can take a few minutes. Fortunately, the matches themselves don't even last half an hour, and sticking around from one match to another can be quick as you have more people in your squad. Matchmaking errors can happen from time to time, but there is very little hassle to throw yourself and your squad right back in.

The community is like most: The loud, obnoxious sorts will be obvious, though there are many that enjoy the communications and tactical aspect over your rush-and-teabag sorts.

The game *is* balanced, you just have to learn how to deal with specific Operators, learn your weapons, positions, and devices, and most importantly, listen! The game has many audio and visual clues for intruders or campers. Hackers have a very small presence, but the new implementation of a report system is actually a testament to the evolution of the programmers' decisions that improve the game.

reviewText:
Although Rainbow Six Siege is one of the most fun games I have ever had the pleasure of playing, I absolutely hate it. After the ridiculous and unadressed problems I have encountered, I felt obligated to warn any potential buyers. I have 8 GB of RAM, a GTX 760, an Intel Core i5-4670, 3 full HD monitors, Windows 10 Home, and I have been gaming on with these specs for about 3-4 years. These specs aren't the best, but I can run every game at ease at at least 60fps on high settings. My internet has a download speed of about 105 MB/s and an upload speed of 12 MB/s. (Skip to 3rd paragraph to see how this is relevant)

So it all started when I my knife from CS:GO and i received about $130. I went on a buying spree and ended up buying Rainbow Six Siege. A few of my friends had it and they recommened it to me. I was craving for a tactical and modern shooter that supported competitive play. Rainbow Six Siege was the answer. I buy and launch the game and play with one of my friends. I pick up a control after finding the mouse to be outrageously too sensitive and begin to pretend to listen to my friend who is trying to tell me how to play as i begin shooting in random directions. This is when the problems arose.

I began to repeatedly get an error after I tried to rejoin again and again that stated error:0-0x00000204" It said that my ethernet connection was plugged in wrong or unplugged. I have had the exact same set up for 3-4 years. I have never received this problem. I reset my router and made sure my WiFi was working by loading Google.com and youtube.com. I tried to join another game and within a minute
date: I received the error again. I tried this for 15 minutes and I was shutdown by the error every single time. I left the game in my library unplayed until the next patch came out a few days later releasing the new operators. I played the game again and had 0 problems whatsoever and even spent 7 hours until 5 in the morning playing Rainbow Six Siege. At this point I was in love with the game and was going to ignore every other game I was currently playing in order to play more Rainbow Six Siege. I was busy with school
recommended: unfortunately. I came back one day
hoursPlayed: about a week or two later
voteText: to play the game. It had another patch to be downloaded. I downloaded the patch and began playing.  Before I could finish a single round i received the same error code I have received at least 20 times before. I tried to play again with little success and I began to be able to play 2 rounds instead of half of 1. On top of the errors
helpfulPercent: every time I played
votesHelpful: frames were skipping. This made the game completely  unplayable . The latest patch
votesTotal: at this point
votesFunny: was supposed to smooth gameplay on top of fix glitches. In the patch notes it directly states "Fix of various disconnect issues". The new patch completely broke my game. I had skipping frames on a decent gaming computer and internet problems on fast internet.\n\nOverall
commentsCount: beware of buying this extremely unreliable game. You may either buy the game and have upwards of 1000 hours on it
column16: or you could be cursed with bugs and problems that may never get attention by lazy Ubisoft."

reviewText:
Although Rainbow Six Siege is one of the most fun games I have ever had the pleasure of playing, I absolutely hate it. After the ridiculous and unadressed problems I have encountered, I felt obligated to warn any potential buyers. I have 8 GB of RAM, a GTX 760, an Intel Core i5-4670, 3 full HD monitors, Windows 10 Home, and I have been gaming on with these specs for about 3-4 years. These specs aren't the best, but I can run every game at ease at at least 60fps on high settings. My internet has a download speed of about 105 MB/s and an upload speed of 12 MB/s. (Skip to 3rd paragraph to see how this is relevant)

So it all started when I my knife from CS:GO and i received about $130. I went on a buying spree and ended up buying Rainbow Six Siege. A few of my friends had it and they recommened it to me. I was craving for a tactical and modern shooter that supported competitive play. Rainbow Six Siege was the answer. I buy and launch the game and play with one of my friends. I pick up a control after finding the mouse to be outrageously too sensitive and begin to pretend to listen to my friend who is trying to tell me how to play as i begin shooting in random directions. This is when the problems arose.

I began to repeatedly get an error after I tried to rejoin again and again that stated error:0-0x00000204" It said that my ethernet connection was plugged in wrong or unplugged. I have had the exact same set up for 3-4 years. I have never received this problem. I reset my router and made sure my WiFi was working by loading Google.com and youtube.com. I tried to join another game and within a minute
date: I received the error again. I tried this for 15 minutes and I was shutdown by the error every single time. I left the game in my library unplayed until the next patch came out a few days later releasing the new operators. I played the game again and had 0 problems whatsoever and even spent 7 hours until 5 in the morning playing Rainbow Six Siege. At this point I was in love with the game and was going to ignore every other game I was currently playing in order to play more Rainbow Six Siege. I was busy with school
recommended: unfortunately. I came back one day
hoursPlayed: about a week or two later
voteText: to play the game. It had another patch to be downloaded. I downloaded the patch and began playing.  Before I could finish a single round i received the same error code I have received at least 20 times before. I tried to play again with little success and I began to be able to play 2 rounds instead of half of 1. On top of the errors
helpfulPercent: every time I played
votesHelpful: frames were skipping. This made the game completely  unplayable . The latest patch
votesTotal: at this point
votesFunny: was supposed to smooth gameplay on top of fix glitches. In the patch notes it directly states "Fix of various disconnect issues". The new patch completely broke my game. I had skipping frames on a decent gaming computer and internet problems on fast internet.\n\nOverall
commentsCount: beware of buying this extremely unreliable game. You may either buy the game and have upwards of 1000 hours on it
column16: or you could be cursed with bugs and problems that may never get attention by lazy Ubisoft."

reviewText:
Rainbow six siege in a nutshell...the game starts after waiting 10 minutes to find a match. I'm on defense. My teammates don't talk to each other and OH GREAT...one of them just backed out of the game. Now it's an unbalanced match. I begin barricading the walls and laying down traps. One of my teammates feels like a dbag and shoots me in the back. I call for help. No one comes. We lose and another teammate leaves the match.

Next round and still no one talks to each other. We scout the area with our drones and fail to find the enemy site. The match begins. I breach a window. The moment the window is breached I spot an enemy that is prone in the corner. I unload my clip into his chest and much to my surprise he is still alive and not moving. At that moment, I know it's over. Two seconds later I get shot by a dude two rooms over that spams his gun through the walls and somehow gets a headshot. We lose again. In chat the enemy team calls us trash. I begin to cry.

Next round on defense again. I Lay traps and wait for the enemies to come. No action for a long time. I begin to move around a little hoping to see something. A few moments later I get one tapped from an enemy shooting through a coin size hole in the wall. I pound my fist in the desk. Suicide seems like a reasonable option. I continue to play for another two hours until my head begins to throb from pound it against the keyboard on my desk.

10 out of 10 would recommend. This game somehow is still fun to me. Don't believe me? Just try it out for yourself and let the suicide vibes roll in.

reviewText:
I want to like it as much as Rainbow 6 Vegas and Vegas 2, but I don't know what it is, I just can't get as attached as I was to those games. I'm even playing it with the same best friend.
Maybe it's the lack of a co-op story mode (There's a single story mission unlockable actually) and customization that I really wanted. I want to see revised versions of Calypso Casino (Every game mode is now Attack and Defend btw) and some of my favourite T-hunt maps. I also miss my M8, but I'm holding out hope that a DLC character will have it later.

As far as the game itself...It has amazing controller support that switches back to keyboard and mouse on the fly. Runs not that well for how it looks graphically (Typically Ubisoft I guess) and the environment destruction is really well done. I miss night vision and thermals, they weren't great in the old games but this was certainly a chance to make them better. The addition of leaning is appreciated. I don't like that you can't play a bunch of the same character, beyond it possibly breaking immersion I don't think it would really affect the gameplay much. (Even then just force it to be unique characters for ranked only? You have to hit level 25 to get there anyway.) I don't understand the leveling system. I'm level 33 and what does that even mean? You get challenges at certain levels, unlock ranked mode, but why is it going any higher? Seems pointless, unfinished, or a leftover from early design stages. The reknown system in this is well paced, and is BLAZINGLY FAST with boosters. I have 24 hours into this and have more than half the roster of characters with all their unlocks before getting someone new. The microtransaction system is reserved for weapons skins and boosters. It's not really intrusive and feels like it's tacked on just to please someone in corperate or fund the map packs (but the season pass should do that already). You won't notice it compared to other games systems. They give you one booster for free to tease your pallate, but you probably won't even need a second one.
Microtransactions are BAD for $60 titles don't get me wrong, but if you have to do them at all I guess this works.

However, overall I feel like too much of the design changes are following MOBA mentalities, like Siege couldn't hold it's own without copying someones ideas for a major league gaming scene elsewhere. Too many sacrifices are made for this mindset, but it still remains enjoyable and very much a tactical game that requires thought and planning. Most of my issues are missing features...The game feels unfinished and lacking.

Compare it to Rainbow 6 Vegas 1 and (Even with all the bugs in that game) this just isn't very full. I want more of this game, but it isn't here. If there's some sort of Siege add-on story mode that comes out for $30 I will buy it without a second thought. And instead of the Recruit" option when you don't select a character you should get the option to make a character with whatever loadout you want...At the sacrifice that they have no special ability. That would be a nice addition. (Again disable this in ranked only?)

I really want the nostalgia to kick in full force and for me to fall in love with this all over again
date: but really really wanting those custom characters and some really large maps with respawns. This feels too compact.\n\nBut honestly it's still a good game and worth a buy. I'm enjoying it now and I'm sure I'll be enjoying it later."

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
English:

I regret to say that after having played for more than 200 hours have big cons that make the gameplay is compromised.
- Match Making constant mistake.
- Ping marking on screen is not real-time then you can not watch when players have fluctuations in their connections ..
- Uplay is a disastrous platform and does everything possible to not be able to play with your friends.
- Bugs everywhere.
- Hit Box unrepaired.
- And as a finishing touch has no dedicated server for the community which forces you to play Ubisoft's servers which always have high latency.

This game will own dedicated servers for the community of R6 dies in a couple of months.

I do not recommend it.

Lamento decir que luego de haberlo jugado durante más de 200 horas tiene grandes contras que hacen que la jugabilidad se vea comprometida.
- Match Making error constantes.
- El ping que marca en pantalla no es en tiempo real entonces no podés ver cuando los jugadores tienen fluctuaciones en sus conexiones.
- Uplay es una plataforma desastrosa y que hace todo lo posible para que no puedas jugar con tus amigos.
- Bugs por todas partes.
- Hit Box sin arreglar.
- Y como broche de oro no posee servidor dedicado para la comunidad lo cual te obliga a jugar en los servers de Ubisoft los cuales siempre tienen mucha latencia.

Este juego sin servers dedicados propios para la comunidad de R6 se muere en un par de meses.

No lo recomiendo.

reviewText:
The game is for those who enjoy the multiplayer aspect of games.  It is, better then Counter Strike Global Offensive at the moment of writing this.  The game has a great community.  Although some critics say the game lacks content with only 10-ish maps and 3 gamemodes.  It is important to note that the game has 3 great gamemodes, as other 60 USD games that are multiplayer only have 8 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gamemodes and 2 ok gamemodes.  For the maps, 8 out of the 10 are great and the other 2 are good but difficult to play(big).  Also, the maps typically are divided into 3 small sections, these sections contain a hostage at random, or of your choosing depending whether are not you are playing ranked or casual.  So it is more like 30 small maps since you only play on one section of the map at a time.  If you mainly play singleplayer games this is not for you, but it is not being advertised as single player game.  Ever since CS GO died, I have not felt a sence of joy from a competative shooter in a long time, this game gave me that joy.  Also, the game has microtransactions for skins, though I think Ubisoft nailed the microtransactions since they are only for skins and the microtransactions pay for the FREE map packs and operators.  Although it does have its bugs and poor every now and then, Ubisoft did it, and I never thought I would be saying that.

9/10 Great game

Pros: Funs shooter
Great community
Great maps
Filled with multiplayer content

Cons: Bugs
Poor Servers

reviewText:
Best FPS Game of 2016.

Pros:

- Great PC Optimization: On my crappy laptop (i5-3337u + GT 740m), 55+ FPS at all times on all low. Most likely higher for anyone owning anything better than what I have.

- Great Graphics from Low to Ultra

- Interactable Environment

- Balanced Gameplay

- Can be played both Casually and Competitively

- Free Maps without Season Pass

- Fairly cheap, but good-looking Camos

- Good sound quality


Cons:

- Cheaters in Competitive Mode: (Before the update, there were only cheaters in competitive mode, and extinct in casual. After the Dust Line Update, I haven't seen a cheater in 6 of my competitive games, though this may be due to the cheats not updated to the latest version)

- New Operators are only accessable to Season Pass owners, which may or may not give a competitive advantage to those owning those operators

- Many Griefers in Casual

- Low Competitive Cooldown Time (15 Mins)


Overall:

8/10

- It would be better if Ubisoft had done a harder job preventing cheaters, but overall, a really fun game! Really worth my CS:GO knife, and also got it on sale for $40 three weeks ago. $40 may be the lowest price once it's on sale.

reviewText:
I absolutely love this game. There's an extremely surprising amount of depth in the interactions between the operators and all of the game's different systems (audio and controls are A++ IMO).

The biggest contributor to this depth is the destructible materials located throughout large portions of most maps. Almost every operator's special ability involves operating with these destructible object - whether it floors, walls, boarded up doorways (defenders can board up doorway in their spare time to slow the advance of the attackers), etc. Some of the depth is subtle like learning to properly use audio - both to locate the enemy (with the help of cameras/drones), and to play mind games with the enemy (by making lots of noise to the distract them - a good example of this is running far from the objective right at round start (when the attackers get 1 minute to use drones only to try and find the objective) and shoot a bunch, punch out windows, and board up doors to draw the enemy drones to you so you can kill them and prevent them from finding the objective (causing them to waste time when the round proper begins). It certainly has its flaws, but UBI has been doing fantastic in addressing them IMO.

The most recent update is great and fixes lots of big things, and adds lots of great new and unexpected features.

reviewText:
LENGTHY REVIEW
I have been playing Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege since November of last year and have been able to complete all situations and missions within the multiplayer game. There are many positive and negative aspects of the game which will be addressed appropriately. The positives, oks and negatives will be discussed below.

POSITIVE
-ENGAGING MAPS AND ENVIRONMENTS: Tom Clancy games have always had tactical and immersive maps ranging from office buildings to yachts. Siege is not an exception; the maps have all been designed to be destroyed and to have planned insertions of areas and buildings. Maps such as banks, embassy’s, club houses and ports all enhance the gaming experience.

-GUN FIGHTS AND FACTIONS: There are a lot of weapons in siege and each character(s) have different weapons and skills designated to their class. Factions such as the SAS or GIGN have two different classes within their faction designed for defending and attacking. The gunplay is interesting and has a wide range of snipers, automatic rifles and shotguns to choose from. The variation of classes and weapons deters each match from being like each other.

MEDIOCRES
-MATCH DESIGN, GAMEMODES AND TACTIC PLANNING: Siege has done ok with this aspect. However in matchmaking there is very little time or chance to play or communicate with other team members. This is partially the communities fault as there is a chance to explore the map and make defenses before each round however the community never responds to any commands or any tactical output. Terror hunt is intriguing however the AI responsiveness and lack of imagination is relevant.

NEGATIVES
-ROUND TIME, PACE AND CONTINUABILITY: Between each round of siege teams are required to observe the map and make defenses. This is necessary in a tactical planning game however this can take away from the aspect that this is actually a video game. Switching from a fast paced firefight to a boring drone sequence in seconds is painful. I really believe that this aspect will deter players from finding the game ‘fun’ in the long term (once the hype has calmed).

END NOTES
To summarise the game is defiantely playable if you enjoy tactical battles and have a solid team lined up to play with. If you think going solo is more your thing i wouldn't suggest thing game however if you are still eager to play there is VOIP and text chat if you get lucky and get a team that communicates. In my situation I have actually found it enjoyable and worthy of my money spent. The graphics and weapon mechanics are enough for me to suggest this game to my friends and colleagues.

reviewText:
Started the free weekened expecting to play it for a couple of hours, ended up playing twenty, so is this a game I would recommend? Absolutely, but is it for everyone? Absolutely not, let's start with a simple pros and cons list.

Pros:
The gameplay is really fun.
The variety in characters allows you to try out different playstyles.
No character is more overpowered than the other, every character is meant to cater to different playstyles.
Each character has a choice between at least two weapons, usually an assault rifle and a shotgun.
The weapon customization is limited enough that you should never be at a disadvantage against any enemies because of their weapon.
The destruction is very well done, and is very fun, it requires focus to shoot people through walls or windows.
The two teams either attack or defend, and neither one is dull.
The combat is really good, usually both teams have an advantage over the other.
A lot of other stuff that wouldn't fit in there.

Cons:
The gameplay can be a bit repitive for some people.
Team killers are not that common, but they can completely ruin a game.
Lack of teamwork, everyone usually goes their own ways, but when there is teamwork, it's really well done.
Matchmaking can be a bit unfair, I've been in a team full of level 10s against a team full of level 60s.
The ubisoft servers can be slow at times, I've never experienced lag spikes, but I have experienced rubber-banding and long loading times.
I can't really think of that many bad things about the game, so I'll leave it off here.

So, if you're still not sure whether this game is for you or not, I'm going to analyze the game a bit deeper.

The Teams:

There are two teams in the game, blue and orange, the blue team always starts off attacking, and the orange team always starts off defending, they then alternate between the two in a repeating manner, attack/defense/attack/defense.
The team that attacks has access to tiny 2-wheeled drones that can go in tight spots and under doorways to try and spot the enemies, the team that defends has access to cameras placed all around the map, usually 2-3 outside and everything else on the inside, they can be controlled by dead people, so that dying doesn't bore you.
You can see your teammates through walls with white outlines, and their nametags, that's how you know if someone is on your team or not.

The Gameplay:

Let's start off with the basics, there are two teams as explained above, each have 5 players, the defense team must defend an area that either contains two bombs, a hostage, or a container, each of these objectives count as a gamemode. From the point of view of the attack team, the two bombs must be stopped by using a defuser, the hostage must be saved, and the container is like area control, stand in the room, and control the area.

Defense Team:

The defense team can secure the area using an unlimited amount of door/window barricades, and each player has two individual wall reinforcers that can only be broken by the character thermite, each character has its own individual ability that only they can use, for the defense they are mostly support abilities, or traps, for the attack team, it is usually something that allows you to breach through walls more easily, or a different way of attacking.

Attack Team:

Now, those are the basics of the defense, the attack team is different though.
When you attack you start off with 45 seconds using the two-wheeled drones to try and find your objective and identify your enemies to see what character they have, once you have either located the objective, or failed to locate it, you enter the map and try to finish your objective, either save the hostage, defuse the bombs, or secure an area, if all members from either team die, the team left standing wins by default.

The Combat:

The combat in the game is pretty straightforward, you point and shoot, though if you stand out in the open you'll be easily killed, so covers are often used, if you're not careful though, a wall you use as a cover might end up being your death once someone shoots through it, so while covers are important, you need to make sure that the cover is safe and reinforced, unlike another Ubisoft game, you don't go in cover by pressing a button, you have complete freedom of where you stand, no locking on.
The different weapon types change the combat up a bit, you can be a close range fighter with the shotgun, or a medium to long range fighter with the assault rifles, I prefer the assault rifles, but I've been murdered by shotguns many times, while shotguns are quicker kills, they require close proximity to an enemy for it to be at its most efficient, and while assault rifles are a bit slower, they allow longer range and can allow you to shoot through tiny spots more easily.
While weapon choice is important, how efficient it is is also decided by what kind of person you are, do you like shotguns better, or assault rifles? But even if you choose weapons that you prefer, it still requires a bit of skill to be able to anticipate the movements of people, you have to listen and look carefully to give yourself an approximation of your enemie's location.

Now I would write more about the game, but I don't really know what to write about next, so I guess that's all I really have to say about Rainbow Six: Siege, if anyone has any idea what I could add to this review I'll try and add it.

reviewText:
Honestly one of the best online communities I've ever played with. I usually score 0/0/3 and apologize for my mistakes. Whenever I do, someone will always say it's okay that I'm still new and learning, and everyone was like that. It's nice to know that a competitive fps game has such a nice community.

Pros of the game
+ Nice community
+ Guns feel nice
+ Classes are all diverse
+ Games are quick and you have the ability to play with the people again
+ How sound works is very nice

Cons of the game
- Matchmaking is terrible
- Servers aren't all that great
- Can be pretty dead at times
- Some classes get rarely played

Minor greviences that only really relate to me
~ I suck at the game
~ Using your voice can be pretty important to talk


Like many others have said, get the game on sale, the servers suck and some classes aren't all that flash, but it is a really good game, and I don't really enjoy competitive, skill based fps games.

reviewText:
The game is definitely fun. It's mostly a co-op game. If you have played GTA V - Online Heists, I find this as a counterpart of the heists. In GTA V, you were the terrorist, here you are the cop. The game is quite intense due to reality-like recoil and low health bar with no radars (unlike Counter strike series or GTA V). My friend and I joked around to beat the first mission in the terrorist attack at the hardest level. Results? we have failed miserably and passed an hour without completing a single mission. However we definitely had fun :D. We met some random people online who helped to guide us in the end, but we still have failed X(. Nice community, quite-challenging game (based on level chosen), definitely would be spending more time on this game.

Another great game from the UBISOFT team.
This game is a fast action, short map, tactical pace game. Whether you want to defuse the bomb, free the hostages or just take out some terrorists, this game makes sure you do this in style.
Can't find a way through? Not a problem just make your own way through with a list full of explosives and tactical gear.

Also why not try the tactical maps to co-ordinate your teams entry on uplay.
As this is still a new game updates are being released frequently and are constantly changing how the game looks and plays.

Cons:
Short maps or game play at times.
Having more than a couple of tactical equipment options wouldn't go a miss.

reviewText:
I absolutely love this game. There's an extremely surprising amount of depth in the interactions between the operators and all of the game's different systems (audio and controls are A++ IMO).

The biggest contributor to this depth is the destructible materials located throughout large portions of most maps. Almost every operator's special ability involves operating with these destructible object - whether it floors, walls, boarded up doorways (defenders can board up doorway in their spare time to slow the advance of the attackers), etc. Some of the depth is subtle like learning to properly use audio - both to locate the enemy (with the help of cameras/drones), and to play mind games with the enemy (by making lots of noise to the distract them - a good example of this is running far from the objective right at round start (when the attackers get 1 minute to use drones only to try and find the objective) and shoot a bunch, punch out windows, and board up doors to draw the enemy drones to you so you can kill them and prevent them from finding the objective (causing them to waste time when the round proper begins). It certainly has its flaws, but UBI has been doing fantastic in addressing them IMO.

The most recent update is great and fixes lots of big things, and adds lots of great new and unexpected features.

reviewText:
Have played this game for quite a while now and i must say i enjoy this game very much
Although there is an occasional glitch here and there i must say this game is damn addictive

My biggest complaint by far is the fact that the retail version is so so sooooo much more different from the one shown at e3. I'm not sure why many of the features were removed and I'm not sure why the graphics was downgraded. I honestly expected a very realistic game where you had to be careful of you're surroundings or you're pretty much f**ked. But it is realistic compared to a lot of shooters out there today and it is a very good attempt by ubisoft and it was very well done.

I love it, and hate it. Love/Hate relationship. This is probably due to the fact that so many glitches happen that are often game breaking or just utterly irritable. Take my word for it, this game has some game breaking glitches that are super annoying although many of them has been patched now there are still some.

Pros:
-Fun
- Pretty realistic compared to other shooters out there
- Love the in-game currency (renown) which you earn at the end of matches that can assist you in buying new accessories for weapons or unlocking new operators
-Addictive
-Operators are refined and well done. Many of them are fun to play with and have great tools and special characteristics that make them an important asset
-One of the most intense games i have played in a while.

Cons:
-Uplay still has some issues with steam (this might only be me, but i don't know)
- Graphics got downgraded from E3 trailer
- Some bugs in game are still annoying
- e3 gameplay and retail version has large differences. very vast.
-Lack of a single player campaign even though the game is around 60 USD

Overall Rating: 7.9/10

reviewText:
A worthy competitor to Counter-Strike!

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is a first-person tactical shooter, in which players take control of an operator from the Rainbow team, a counter-terrorist unit. Different operators have different races, perks, bombs and gadgets.The game features an asymmetrical structure whereby the teams are not always balanced in their ability choices.Units SWAT, SAS, GSG-9, Spetsnaz and GIGN, each of which has four operators.The game also features a co-op mode to play with friends.

reviewText:
Honestly one of the best online communities I've ever played with. I usually score 0/0/3 and apologize for my mistakes. Whenever I do, someone will always say it's okay that I'm still new and learning, and everyone was like that. It's nice to know that a competitive fps game has such a nice community.

Pros of the game
+ Nice community
+ Guns feel nice
+ Classes are all diverse
+ Games are quick and you have the ability to play with the people again
+ How sound works is very nice

Cons of the game
- Matchmaking is terrible
- Servers aren't all that great
- Can be pretty dead at times
- Some classes get rarely played

Minor greviences that only really relate to me
~ I suck at the game
~ Using your voice can be pretty important to talk


Like many others have said, get the game on sale, the servers suck and some classes aren't all that flash, but it is a really good game, and I don't really enjoy competitive, skill based fps games.

reviewText:
I'm not happy with this video game.

A lot of people compare it to CS:GO because that's where the playerbase came from.  So if you're about that life, you'll enjoy thoroughly wearing your keyboard down talking trash since that's the key pivoting point around this game.

The guns and such are just too strong for the size and shape of the players. Every kill is a headshot because it's the only way to deliver more than 20 damage, but it's about 100 more, always a kill.  And that's with all the guns!  In CS:GO, if you get shot in the head you'll be cripplingly wounded, and getting a shot out to someone's domepiece is a respectable deal, the heads are pretty little.  The heads in Siege though vary in size, almost the size of a nice plump watermelon.  Combine the awful netcode you'll see referenced in the next 10 reviews with the lack of variety in the weapons with the hitbox balancing they chose and it's not a fun shooting game.

People said that Rainbow Six: 3 was the thinking man's shooter" because you had to plan your attack and actually think to play.  Siege didn't end up being a thinking game.  It's ultimately boiled down to a memorization game
date: where you need to memorize the maps before you can start winning.  You have to pick out the right wall to hit the right spot in the floor to hope to god that you trick someone into not looking at you and then you shoot them four times
recommended: the last hit of course being a headshot.  You just repeat that whole procedure through and through until someone finally catches you and you find another hole.\n\nAnother thing I'm unhappy about is the premise.  Look at the art at the top
hoursPlayed: where it shows the logo behind a counter-terrorist team busting through a wall.  The enemies are most definitely terrorists right?  They've got that whole black ski mask thing going on with the hoodies and the pouches on the vest! They're most definitely terrorists!  Then how come the game is actually police killing police?  The defending team is Rainbow Six
voteText: and the attacking team is also Rainbow Six!  I
helpfulPercent: for one
votesHelpful: was looking forward to being a crooked terrorist.\n\nThe most awful part of this game is the fact that it's ended up as a class based game divided between nations.  Rainbow Six is of course international
votesTotal: so there's enough nations here in the game to not offend anyone important.  The dumbest thing though
votesFunny: is that the game is split into classes.  Every country gets two guys per half
commentsCount: those being the classes.  The classes are then forced to use their "country specific weapons"
column16: like the Russians using an AK rifle and the Americans having to use the UMP-45.  For historical reasons and whatnot.  If Rainbow Six was so international

column18:
you'd pick your clothes and guns.

Replace the class select screen with Rainbow Six: 3's customization page.  Make characters logically able to survive a weak headshot.  Make light-medium-heavy armor selections based on the player's choice
column19: not the country.  Add another few dozen weapons

column22: where you get so many tokens to deal with and craft your class from.  Make all the defender and attacker abilities and equipments go into one big pool
column23: and give that big pool to every single player.  Change the defending team to be terrorists

Get rid of those ungodly splash screens and "PRESS ANY BUTTON" screens by default instead of by deleting a folder.  Change the menu fonts and add more pictures to the menu.  Make the soundtrack not blow.  Recreate the thing where you hold to interact to open the list of things of commands for the team

reviewText: Rainbow Six Siege is by far my favorite game. I think a lot of people are negative and overcritical about the game. There are some large issues but they have simple solutions. The game is highly competitive and fun to play. I have put over 600 hours into it and still find it fun to play. The only issue is cheating. Hackers are extremely common due to the fact that FairFight anticheat is plain horrible. This issue created a very toxic community. There is no trust in a ranked match that someone is not cheating because of the (non-existent) anticheat. I am a good player (platinum 3) and also get very lucky time to time. I’ve had to change my name multiple times due to people 'counter-hacking' because they have heard that I cheat. I believe that Ubisoft is aware that the issue NEEDS to be fixed or the game will die soon. I would recommend this game but it plainly cannot be enjoyed fully as it is. The game itself is wonderful, minus cheating. I would 100% recommend it once a competent anticheat is implemented. Until then, the casual game mode is still worth $50 as nothing happens if you lose.

reviewText: Beautiful, well made game. The gameplay is amazing, but challenging enough to the point where you want to play to get better. The Operators are well balanced, as well as the weapons. The tower defence aspect in the game makes it even better. It is similar to CS:GO, but very different at the same time. Personally, I enjoy this more than CS:GO. Now for the few downsides. Teams will make or break the game, and sometimes they aren't put into your favor. The community, however, is friendly and helpful. I have yet to see a negative person or an insult. The Ubisoft servers need a bit of a touch-up, but it is  still fine to play with. A solid 8.5/10 for this, and I look forward to the updates for this game very much.

reviewText:
The biggest mistake Rainbow Six Siege did was to have Rainbow Six in its tittle.

By itself it's an amazing competitive FPS. But if you were looking for a classical Rainbow six game...keep looking.

If we igonre the fact that it's not a classical RBS game what's good and bad?

Pros:

Very good map design
Interesting characters to chose from
Well optimized
Free dlc for everyone
Pretty nice community
Nice visuals
Awesome sounds
PVE for those who don't like PVP.

Cons:

A few bugs and glitches
Matchmaking can stop working sometimes (pretty rare since the fix)
No singleplayer campaign
Ubisoft servers do mess up now and then.

Note:

This game is best played with friends. You don't have to be a full team but it really help if you're just two.

If you've got some friends to play this with, then play it...seriously.

reviewText:
I absolutely love Rainbow Six: Siege, I've put more than 200 hours into this game at the time I'm writing this. Unfortunately I cannot recommend you play this under its current state. Here's a list of all the things the game does succeeds in and fails.

Pro's:

1. Unique gameplay, Rainbow Six takes the concept of attack and defend games and pushes it to a whole new level, there are many ways to attack and objective and defend it. Combined with all of the unique operators and varied maps, I almost never found myself getting bored.

2. Very well balanced, every operator has they're strengths and weaknesses. Most of the time the game feels fair and the only time someone has the advantage is when they're in a superior position. Unfortunately there are a few exceptions to this such as the secondary SMG with an acog scope. This gives defenders essentially a pocket sniper and is very abused in this game.

Con's:

1. Awful servers, Sometimes it takes several minutes to find enough players for a game, and at very inoportune times I've found myself or teamates disconnecting from the game due to poor server connection.

2. Terrible hit detection/Netcode, more often than not I've found myself being killed by a guy who wasn't or when I've moved to cover. This happens way more than it should in a competetive shooter and Ubisoft hasn't done much to address it. The hit detection is very bad too, I've seen way to many kill cams where the guy has shot me and hit reticle wasn't anywhere near my body, this is unbelievably frustrating to be killed by poor game mechanics and not the skill of the other players.

3. Damage model, in this game a headshot is a one hit kill, this causes a lot of problems in firefights where one person is hitting their marks but get shot by another who is just wildly spraying and manages to land a lucky headshot, this means that SMG's can out shoot assault rifles in this game if the SMG wielder somehow manages to land a headshot on an attacker at distances that shouldn't be acceptable.

I really hope Ubisoft will patch these current issues and make this game great, I still love it even though it's not at the level it could be at.

reviewText:
Got the starter addition for $15.00 rather than the actual $50.00 asking price and honestly feel sorry for anyone that spent that much on the game. In my opinion, as limited as the game is in content (only multiplayer and bots) the game should be $15.00 max.

Pros:
- Team based gameplay
- Specialized classes (operators)
- Fun gameplay
- Very well done maps and enviroments
- Good graphics

Cons:
- Limited content (1 - 2 guns per operator)
- Only 2 overall gamemodes (terrorist hunt and multiplayer)
- Awful matchmaking (getting put agianst people way better or worse than you)
- Hackers
- Long loading times (1 - 3 minutes)
- Uplay isn't as annoying but it still has its usual hicupps

Wouldn't reccomend this game for the actual asking price but for $15.00? I really can't argue. Rather you get that version that the $50.00 one. Also the season pass is a waste of money considering you can get its content in game with the ingame currency.

reviewText:
So, basically, this would be an amazing game if Ubisoft actually gave a ♥♥♥♥ about its players.

There are tons of bugs that have been in the game since release and have not been fixed even though its been out for nearly 8 months now.

The current anti-hacking system is about as useless as a one-legged man in an ♥♥♥♥ kicking competition, so there for, ranked and even to a lesser extent, casual are plagued with hackers, that don't get automatically banned and reporting them won't do ♥♥♥♥.

Instead of fixing all of these problems, Ubisoft pushes new content every couple of weeks in an attempt to make you forget about how utterly broken their game is.

And finally, the only decent game type for the most part is Terrorist Hunt since if you play casual, you get placed with absolute pillocks, and, as stated previously, ranked is full of hackers.

And don't even get me started on the community. Literally one of the WORST communities I've seen in game in a long ♥♥♥♥ing time. There are a bunch of trolls that join only to kill half their team as soon as the game starts, as stated above, tons of hackers, and finally, a majority of the community are complete prats. Literally, just the other day, I was for the most part carrying my team, and they kicked me because apparently the 2 seconds it took me to load at the beginning of every round was too slow for them. I'm not bloody kidding about this either.


So, overall

Game mechanics: 5/10 (would be 9/10 if they bothered to fix all the problems)
Fun to play?: No, not really.
Hacker free?: Hell no.
Community: 0/10.

reviewText:
This game is fun and i really enjoy playing it.
That said, its a real shame it doesnt work 70% of the time. Endless loading screens, if you join games, disconnects and some other issues...

The thing is, that they somehow ♥♥♥♥ed up the matchmaking (atleast in normal mode), so its pretty common to get matched against people 30-50 levels above you. Atleast i can play the game now, looks like a step in the right direction (I still wouldnt recommend it as it is now (14th January 2016). Ill edit my review again, if anything important changes.

reviewText: This is by far the most realistic and intense tactical first person shooter on the market. It's has 11 maps at release, each one unique unto itself. Twenty different special operators each bringing there own skill set for great variety. This is easily THE FPS to play, better than the competition. It looks great, sounds great and handles great. It's a pull no punches approach to a genre that has left its roots in realism for something to science fiction as of late. The matches are tight and intense and at any moment can shift from winning to losing if you are careful. The maps are fully interactive with security cameras to get the drop on your opponents to breachable walls to create your own path. Plenty of room for a large variety of strategies on both sides, so whether your attack or defense you and your team can create a style all your own. So if you like a seriously intense game play rooted in reality answer the call and join Rainbow6!

reviewText:
Played the free weekend.
Feels like CS and RB6 had a child and this is the result, not in a good way.
Instead of kitting your guy out with what ever you feel you need you have to choose from Operators that have certain equipment tied to them.
Maps are ok, lots of entryways and the destruction is nice.
Netcode is absolute dogshit, enemy movement is delayed by about 05-1s even with 70 ping. This results in enemies killing you before you can even see them on your own screen because on their end they have been looking at you for 0,5s already and firing. 90% of the times I died I could not see the person coming around the corner shooting at me before I was already dead even when I was looking right at them. This results in peekaboo leaning tactics being the only winning move making fast reflexes useless.
If you are looking for an actual RB6 game, this is not it, it's an ok FPS game but not worth more than 15€ in my opinion.

reviewText:
Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is one hell of a game. Its fun, its tactical and its hard. However it's also a spawn of ubisoft which makes it a bit of a flawed gem.

Pros:

Excellent Gameplay: its hard, your character is not a bullet sponge. Cooperating with your team mates is the key to success. In addition, each operator has unique interesting skills/abilities which adds variety to the game.

Nice Graphics: not only this game looks good but it also runs good,

Destructible environments: battlefield does them as well but it adds no strategy element to the game other than nice effects. On the contrary, in Rainbox Six Siege, the destruction of the environment plays a major role in tactics and strategy.

Interesting Levels: well designed and realistic looking, with a lot of variety between them (plus night and day variations of the same maps).

Cons:

Uplay integration, i hate it. I don't need another steam clone, one is enough.

UBISOFT SERVERS, literally the biggest issue with this game are the servers. They are literally rubbish, many issues with them.

Bad matchmaking system

Verdict:

Its fun, its interesting and its hard. However, its PLAGUED by the bad servers and constant network errors. I am optimistic that these are issues that can and will be resolved, however i can not obviously testify for that. Recommended for people who enjoy teamwork and tactical shooters that lean towards realism. COD fans please stay away...

reviewText:
Great game, that realy changes FPS-es. You can no longer run and gun lone wolf as you will get killed eather by traps, or by enemy. Neather you can camp, since enemy will blow a hole right behind you, and killing you. You have to do 2 things:

1. Adapt to different situations and tactics. Except enemy from where you'd expect them the least
2. Coordinate with your team. You are dead alone
3. Stick to cover. Depending on your armor (light 2 shots, medium 4 shots, or heavy 6 shots) you can get killed even if you prone (what in this game you do more often than ever). Not to mention, higher armor = slower speed. Choose carefully.

There are 20 operators, and they are all well matched. You can't choose the right" one. They all have their unique abilities you have to find advantage off
date: or counter them. If your enem is a thermite
recommended:
you should know he will destroy your reinforced walls.

Game is greatly optimised with great graphics. I run medium graphics with 40FPS and the game looks great (never tried high ones).

reviewText:
Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is one hell of a game. Its fun, its tactical and its hard. However it's also a spawn of ubisoft which makes it a bit of a flawed gem.

Pros:

Excellent Gameplay: its hard, your character is not a bullet sponge. Cooperating with your team mates is the key to success. In addition, each operator has unique interesting skills/abilities which adds variety to the game.

Nice Graphics: not only this game looks good but it also runs good,

Destructible environments: battlefield does them as well but it adds no strategy element to the game other than nice effects. On the contrary, in Rainbox Six Siege, the destruction of the environment plays a major role in tactics and strategy.

Interesting Levels: well designed and realistic looking, with a lot of variety between them (plus night and day variations of the same maps).

Cons:

Uplay integration, i hate it. I don't need another steam clone, one is enough.

UBISOFT SERVERS, literally the biggest issue with this game are the servers. They are literally rubbish, many issues with them.

Bad matchmaking system

Verdict:

Its fun, its interesting and its hard. However, its PLAGUED by the bad servers and constant network errors. I am optimistic that these are issues that can and will be resolved, however i can not obviously testify for that. Recommended for people who enjoy teamwork and tactical shooters that lean towards realism. COD fans please stay away...

reviewText:
My Experince
Rainbow Six: Siege is a gem thats still being etched out of its stone. I Love the game so much and I have had some great moments with friends and strangers, but there is still alot to be fixed (and they're working really hard to meet the communities demands, which is great).

Needs to be fixed:

Tickrate (not bad but can be adavanced)
A ton a of movement based glitches and bugs (Getting trapped in corners, sprinting throwing you to prone)
Servers (literally awful so hard to find at some points of the day and sometimes you'll get put into other countries servers
The team base (its fine but there should be a heavier focus on team play, but so far its medicore)
Now don't let that stride you away from purchasing this game, so far I've played with my friends, and we've had some great times. Honestly playing this game with a party of friends is a highlight. You typically will dominate and everything is preformed with a better outcome.

Best Parts of this Game
Combat. Its the best I've seen, its heart pounding around every corner, and every round fired just gives off a suspenseful feel. Watching your bullets shatter drywall and hit your target just gives off satisfication, the simplest things give the best feelings for this title.
Diversity. Its not  Amazing per say, but everyone has a very different play style that gives each match, round, and game its own flavour. Well thought out combinations will pave the way to victory, and the chemistry of certain operators can really bring out a team
Optimization. The game is gorgeous, and I'm below its standards. I have a 660GTX ASUS Laptop and my game look beautiful. I can't believe how smooth it runs. It may be different for others but in my mind its perfect.

Score
89/100

reviewText:
This game deserves more than a 'Mostly Positive' review score and here's why...
The GameplayI never really expected to like a 5v5 game.  I hate Counterstrike and most of my FPS time is invested in Battlefield.  However, Rainbow Six Siege offered a great balance between pace, stakes, and strategy.  Unlike Counterstrike, you won't find yourself sprinting towards the objective full speed attempting to pull off reaction shots.  Rainbow Six Siege is about information.  Know where the enemies are, know where the objective is, and know the best way to get there: that is what wins you the game.
The DLC PolicyI'm shocked more people aren't admiring the game for this.  Basically, you can get all of the important content in this game without paying a single dollar more.  When a DLC comes out, you will get the map and the ability to purchase the new operators instantly.  The only difference is that, if you don't buy the DLC, you will have to pay a large amount of in game credits to buy the operators.  If you do buy the DLC, you get the operators instantly.  Only certain weapon camos are behind a paywall.  For a modern day shooter, this is an amazing deal (especially for Ubisoft)!
The CommunityRight now, nearly all of the top reviews consist of stories of forgiving teammates.  I can atest to the friendliness of the community myself.  However, this is an online game, so your lobbies are going to varry.
Lobby #1: Silent.  You say Hey!" over the microphone and there is only an awkward silence.  The silence is broken when you shoot your teammate accidently and he begins screaming at you over the microphone.
Lobby #2: Plz no.  You hear a man start breathing into his microphone before making a loud scream.  You enter the game and he begins shooting up you and your teammates.  You google search to find out how to kick people.
Lobby #3: Great!  You run into 1 or 2 other people who are social and you don't dare leave this lobby because you will be playing with these people until 1:30 am.
It may take a couple of tries to get to Lobby #3 but the game is extremely fun once you have a sociable team.
The BugsThere are issues with the game.
Issue #1: The greatest issue being the game favoring players with high ping in an effect Matimio likes to call "Peeker's Advantage."  Basically
date:
whoever peeks the corner has an advantage because the player movement takes a split second to register for the enemy watching the corner.
Issue #2: Guns / body morphing through the wall is a tremendous issue.  Getting killed by this is extremely frusterating and it should be fixed.
Issue #3: Defenders will run outside of the house at the beginning of the game to gun down the attackers.  The attackers can't do much about it either due to lack of cover.
All other issues aren't significant enough but just look at some negative reviews to see all of them.  However
recommended: Ubisoft is making a good effort to fix these problems.\nConclussionRainbow Six Siege offers a refeshing 5v5 shooter unlike any other.  Watch a gameplay video to see how complex and fun it can be.  Just keep in mind the community can be great
hoursPlayed: you might just have to go through a couple of lobbies before you find a really great team.  There are a few issues but Ubisoft is making a great effort to fix them.  Last but not least
voteText: the DLC policy is great!  You can get all of the operators and maps in this game without paying a penny more!"
