reviewText:
I'd like to just point out what might be an issue for you if you decide to buy this game. First off, I'd like to acknowledge that I have played well over 500 hours of this game. I started playing this game a week after it came out. I was insanely addicted and enjoyed the unique/great qualities that I thought made it stand out among the current FPS genre. However, I am not here to tell you not to buy the game or vice versa. I would just like to point out how I feel this far into the game. Obviously I wouldn't have invested 500 hours into the game if I didn't enjoy it, right? So I am wanting to just make you consider what you might be investing your time and money into.

So let me begin by saying the price is insane for what you get. I would argue it is at most worth $20-$30 dollars USD. Especially considering the game is primarely set in multiplayer (there really isn't a singleplayer campaign).

I'd like to mention that I expected bugs in this game when I bought it, I knew that there where known issues because I waited a bit to see the gameplay and reactions to the official release of the game. I always knew that they where going to address these issues and hopefully fix them. However, this game has been out for about 5 months now and I can't see much differences from what I first saw when I started. Infact I would say the netcode has been beaten down to a dull and unreliable state as they updated it to the current 2.2 patch. I would just need to mention the state of headshots and people who have already played would understand that they don't register as they should. Just go to YouTube and you will find dozens of videos showing off this netcode and it's trash progression to the current state it is in. I could write a page full of bugs and other issues-though they actually already do have a list on their reddit (lol)-but I will make it short and sweet. Some of these problems are as follows: wonderful Uplay problems that also sprinkle in it's own fun, the servers are unreliable, and the hackers can ruin your fun (not as often anymore but it still happens occasionally).

But I mean despite all of these issues I have enjoyed this game a lot. It just seems recently I have met my patience and tolerance for these issues. In my opinion, this game game is split dead even in what I can and cannot enjoy abou this game. So if you are ready to deal with these issues and make the best of it, enjoy. Otherwise, seek a more reliable FPS than this, you won't be pleased if you buy this.

I wanted to show my support for this unique game when I purchased it. What are the chances we will ever see another game like this in the near future? I was willing at the time to deal with these issues and attempt to enjoy this game. I suggest you look into this game and consider these things before you buy.

I know I didn't really give any feedback on what is good about the game, but I was assuming that you had already done some research and watched some gameplay. Most people avoid cracking down on ALL of the CURRENT issues facing the game when they make an impressions" video. Generally when they cover the "overall impressions" they do so when they first start playing. Since this game has been updated things have severely changed and it is hard to tell what has actually been fixed.

Anyway
date: thanks for reading and good luck making your choice!"

reviewText:
Played the free weekend.
Feels like CS and RB6 had a child and this is the result, not in a good way.
Instead of kitting your guy out with what ever you feel you need you have to choose from Operators that have certain equipment tied to them.
Maps are ok, lots of entryways and the destruction is nice.
Netcode is absolute dogshit, enemy movement is delayed by about 05-1s even with 70 ping. This results in enemies killing you before you can even see them on your own screen because on their end they have been looking at you for 0,5s already and firing. 90% of the times I died I could not see the person coming around the corner shooting at me before I was already dead even when I was looking right at them. This results in peekaboo leaning tactics being the only winning move making fast reflexes useless.
If you are looking for an actual RB6 game, this is not it, it's an ok FPS game but not worth more than 15€ in my opinion.

reviewText:
I've played this game since closed beta, and honestly I've been hard pressed to find a more enjoyable FPS out there. I'm not much for competition usually, preferring PVE in almost every case, but Siege brings a nuanced gameplay of cat and mouse, bouncing back between attack and defend that keeps me coming back. Yes, I started Terrorist Hunt, almost exclusively upon release. However, once my friends and I squadded up and went multi for the first time, we haven't looked back. This is a team based game that builds solid synergy between friends and forms you into a squad where everyone knows their roles and what to expect from one another. My coworkers/friends and I have come back for hours upon hours of team based gameplay. The destructable environments really set the game apart, making the possibility to experience a different round every time, constantly requiring you to adapt and overcome. Intel is the name of the game, and knowing where your enemy is is a gamechanger.

Siege is my GO TO shooter. There are bugs sometimes, there are exploits occasionally, but credit where it's due to ubisoft patching what the community asks for 9 times out of 10.

Siege is a solid 9.5/10 for me, and offers fun in a way that no other squad on squad shooter, to date, has.

reviewText:
I've played this game since closed beta, and honestly I've been hard pressed to find a more enjoyable FPS out there. I'm not much for competition usually, preferring PVE in almost every case, but Siege brings a nuanced gameplay of cat and mouse, bouncing back between attack and defend that keeps me coming back. Yes, I started Terrorist Hunt, almost exclusively upon release. However, once my friends and I squadded up and went multi for the first time, we haven't looked back. This is a team based game that builds solid synergy between friends and forms you into a squad where everyone knows their roles and what to expect from one another. My coworkers/friends and I have come back for hours upon hours of team based gameplay. The destructable environments really set the game apart, making the possibility to experience a different round every time, constantly requiring you to adapt and overcome. Intel is the name of the game, and knowing where your enemy is is a gamechanger.

Siege is my GO TO shooter. There are bugs sometimes, there are exploits occasionally, but credit where it's due to ubisoft patching what the community asks for 9 times out of 10.

Siege is a solid 9.5/10 for me, and offers fun in a way that no other squad on squad shooter, to date, has.

reviewText:
Rainbow Six Siege is a classic case of a game with a lot of potential and great ideas that didn't do enough to stay relevant. This is due to a number of issues, for the sake of time I'll only list a few. Before I continue I should say right out of the gate that I do think that this is a great game with a lot of amazing ideas, the issue for me isn't a lack of innovation but rather the whole experience being brought down by it's shortcomings.

A somewhat subjective issue with the game is one that most team based games fall prey to; lack of incentive to work together. There isn't much incentive for teams to work together which results in everyone running around doing their own thing. For some this isn't a major issue since they may like to go it alone anyway but for people that like the team element of the game it can be a bit tiring. This by no means is always the case but when you do encounter it the experience is lessened somewhat.

Another issue with the game is the online population, while there still are many people playing this game the effects of players moving on are already apparent. At peak hours you'll likely not have any trouble getting into a match but at later hours you can sometimes wait several minutes to play. This is an issue that will likely only get worse with time, making the $70 price a bit too steep considering the longevity of the game.

Hit detection/net-code is another issue I've found really stands out in this game to the point where I question how a AAA game could have such significant issues with this. For an in depth look at this video check out This

The Forth and final issue I'll point out is in regards to the anti-cheat system, or lack thereof. Siege might have one of the worst problems with cheaters I've seen in years for a AAA title. The reporting system does nothing or at the very least almost nothing to solve this issue and it doesn't look like Ubisoft will come up with a fix anytime soon or at all.

reviewText:
Highly recommended to all CooP Stylers and TDM junkies!

You can choose between SinglePlayer, up to 5-ppl-coop-team against the AI or 5vs5 TDM.
Currently there are 10 beautiful designed maps where you can unleash hell or sneak your butt off.

Also you can play several mission types like:
- classic terrorist hunt = kill all remaining enemies on the maps
- defuse the bombs = locate and defuse 2 bombs randomly placed on the maps
- extract the hostage = like in CS, find and escort the hostage back to the extraction point
- defend the hostage = barricade yourself and try to stay alive through several waves of incoming maniacs

With completing missions and/or killing guys you will get points to unlock new operators, equipment, weapons and such.

Massive fun clearing the buildings with a couple of mates vs the AI imo and so much better than this overkill'ed +$!&?= i used to play ...

nuff said!

reviewText: Ubisofts' aim with R6 Siege was to create a competitive, tactical and realistic team-based FPS. It was meant to change the way we played games and to show us that we don't have to have bigger battlefields to have the most fun. It was supposed to be skill based and very competitive. They even decided to team up with ESL to try and create a competitive eSports atmosphere. Sadly though, Ubisoft's final product falls short of their aim. It is true, the gameplay is fantastic and diverse, it is extremely realistic and fun to play most days, but, it is in no way a competitive game.\n\nThe idea of competition is to create a setting that puts each player on an equal playing field, so that a person's skill is what makes the difference between winning and losing. Since this is an online game it can be difficult to create a truly  perfect" setting given things outside of developers control like ping and the location of its players in the world

reviewText:
Good game, good players, horribly maintained.
Community is really friendly comparing to most of other FPS games. Game itself is pretty fun. Still had a lot of fun even tho there's limited number of maps and operaters (extension about to release).

HOWEVER, such a good game is totally ruined by: horrible servers, tons of unfixed clitches and lack of anti-hacking systems. Imagine this, you are camping a window barricaded by wooden panels which has 0 visibility from outside to inside; you're not making a single move so you're totally silent. Suddenly, a 30.cal bullet shoot through the panel and head shot you, and the guy took the shot all the way on roof of the building cross the alley. Or, when you are attacking, your team poped some smoke to cover your advance and all three of you get head shot when you're walking through the smoke by a guy with a pistol on the other side of the hallway.

You're ♥♥♥♥♥♥, yet you didn't give up. You start another game with a new team. Yet, probably due to your poor performance in the last round, Ubisoft give you a punishment by not showing you the loadout page, and the system force you to pick the recruit" soldier. More than that

reviewText:
2 REASONS TO NOT BUY:
1) Uplay.exe virus
2) The most useless Season Pass ever

10 REASONS TO BUY:
1) Adictive and intuitive gameplay
2) Beautiful maps
3) Trust me: Very adequate and friendly community, I met a lot of russians - they were mostly friendly and knew english.
4) Dynamic, great designed and destroyable enviroment
5) Fixed netcode
6) Micro-transactions (DLC weapon skins) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
7) Customizable and realistic feeling weapons
8) Great and crazy gadgets, starting with drones ending with bear traps
9) Funny fails (Self blow-ups, kapkan blow-ups, teammate blow-ups, blow-ups by a teammate...)
10) Funny bugs (You may say it's con, but they happen rarely and are not totally game-breaking but very fun to watch :D)

Overally you will have a lot of fun here with or without friends. If the fun ends - you can start some serious competitive gameplay, due to the ranked system and the game genre itself. You will have AT LEAST 40-60h of pleasing gameplay for this price, definitely a great game to buy.

reviewText:
This game is one of my favorites, though it has some serious issues. Constant crashes, audio issues, mulitplayer issues, and a plethera of others. Load times can be up to 30 minutes for a round, and terrorist hunt multiplayer is currently completly broken. When this game works, it is great fun, sadly, it does not work often. For some people, this game has no to few noticeable issues, though the majority of people i know have had some large issues. Me and many of my friends have had to port forward just to be able to join a multiplayer game, and sometimes even that doesnt work.
The audio issues are another major issue for me. Only one of my friends has experianced this, but it seems to be common on the support forums. The audio gets really quiet, and gets crackely and cuts out every once and a while. There is a temporary fix to this, though sometimes it will force you to restart rather than fixing the audio issue.
Crashes are; in my opinion, the biggest issue with this game. And they always seem to happen at the absolute worst times. 80% of my crashes happen when trying to get into a ranked game, and this is a huge issue for me and my teammates. Every time this happens my ranked stats take a huge hit, and the team i was placed on is left without a player for a round or two. When i got my first rank, i was in silver 2, now after dozens of crashes, I am in bronze 3, my k/d has been reduced by almost half, and my win/loss is abysmal. You may think I am making this up, and i am really just mad cuz bad. But anyone who has experianced this issue knows my pain.

Thanks Ubisoft, yet another rushed, trashy PC port, I has thought you had learned after Watch_dogs. I am not entirely sure why I had high expectations for this game, once they plastered that Ubisoft logo on it, It was doomed.

reviewText:
This would be a great game if it wasnt a Ubisoft game. Sadly Ubisoft cares only about content so that more people buy the game. They have yet to fix many glitchs in the game itself. Team killers happen every day and I see it 2 times a day atleast.
These people aren't punshed in anyway shape or forum. After that issue we have my personal biggest issue. Connection....
Before this game my highest ping ever was 2142 ping. As of Today it is now over 8000 ping do to the servers, It isn't just me either. I also Rubber-band at 50 ping. WHY? HOW? WTF?. So even when my ping is good I still cant play cause I rubber-Band to much to see anything. HOW IS THIS EVEN ALLOWED TO BE SOLD LIKE THIS?!?!.

The content is also lackluster TBH. The new operators they release are Very expensive to get ahold of game time wise....
This Game is at the moment worth i would say 30 USD. NO MORE(thats with season pass). Is it cool-yes. Is it different-yes, is it Ubisoft-sadly yes it is....

I havent been able to play an actual 4 rounds of this game in almost a week at his point cause it kicks me do to my high ping. Ive seen it more than once where someones else ping will skyrocket, they'll get kicked, then I will be a few minutes behind them......

This is shouldnt be even legal, sadly it is and i bought it, even worse the servers have only gotten worse as time has gone on and i cant get a refund......

-It can be very strategic and tactical if you want it too.

Right now my only biggest gripe is the servers are pretty ♥♥♥♥ing terrible, especially for ranked games. You can play casual all day long and have a blast, but as soon as I got to jump in a ranked match (After getting kicked out and about 30 minutes trying) we all had really bad ping, and 3 out of 4 of us who qued together got kicked out all together of the game before we actually could get a ranked match to work. I'm sure that'll be fixed hopefully soon though. Other than that I really suggest getting this game if you are looking for a different kind of tactical shooter! It may not be like the old rainbow six games like some of us remember, but it is definetly worth getting in my oppinion.

P.S. Please KEEP the community good. Everybody hates when a competitive game turns toxic.
